slides.title: State the promise in one vivid sentence
slides.subtitle: Use this cinematic hero to anchor the story with an emotional, human-centric statement about the future you deliver.

background.alt: Softly lit architectural shapes with glass reflections

slides.notes: Open with your most aspirational message. Keep copy under 14 words. Swap the hero image or use video focusing on light, depth, and calm motion.

slides.title: Guide your audience through the story
slides.subtitle: Set expectations with moments that ladder up to your core argument.

items.title: Context & Shift
items.description: Where the market is moving now

items.title: Mamori Vision
items.description: How we design a calmer future

slides.caption: Aim for balance between inspiration, proof, and next steps.
slides.notes: Keep agenda items short—2 to 3 words for titles. Use verbs that signal motion and momentum.

slides.title: Define the tension keeping customers awake
slides.subtitle: Describe the friction using customer language and one sharp data point.
points: Lead with the human cost—show how people feel stuck, not just the workflow they use.
Quantify the urgency with a single validated stat or qualitative quote.
Explain why legacy tools or habits fail on clarity, timing, or trust.
slides.caption: Three concise bullets keep focus tight and make it easy to retell.
slides.notes: Use this moment to build empathy before you pivot into your solution pillars.

slides.title: Opportunity snapshot
slides.subtitle: Anchor the upside with metrics that quantify momentum and intent.

stats.label: Category demand growth over the past 12 months
stats.caption: Source: industry benchmark

stats.label: Decision makers prioritising transparent AI experiences
stats.caption: Source: customer discovery

stats.label: Near-term value unlocked by solving this friction

slides.caption: Each metric needs a source and a defined measurement window.
slides.notes: Swap in your validated data. If you only have two metrics, set "columns" to 2 for balance.

slides.title: Show how the Mamori experience delivers clarity
slides.subtitle: Each pillar represents a distinct promise anchored in the design language.

items.label: Pillar 01
items.title: Precision onboarding
items.description: Adaptive welcome flows that feel hand-crafted and reduce cognitive load.
highlights: Glass morphism surfaces create depth without sacrificing performance.
Flows adapt in real time using context, intent, and trust signals.

items.label: Pillar 02
items.title: Evidence engine
items.description: Transparent scoring systems that explain outcomes in human language.
highlights: Explainable indicators reveal why decisions were made.
Accessibility-first typography keeps insights readable everywhere.

items.label: Pillar 03
items.title: Continuous guidance
items.description: Always-on nudges that feel calm, not noisy, across every device.
highlights: Physics-based motion guides attention with respectful pacing.
32px pill buttons maintain generous touch targets.

slides.caption: Pillars should mirror your product architecture and stay timeless.
slides.notes: Limit to three or four pillars. Use highlights for proof points or key behaviours.

slides.title: Visualise the signature product flow
slides.subtitle: Pair a hero mock or video with copy that explains how the experience feels.
points: Clarify the user goal in a single sentence.
Call out the design system elements that reinforce trust.
Note the measurable outcome or feedback loop.

media.alt: Product interface showcasing layered glass panels

slides.caption: Media should stay under 2MB and reinforce the calm, human tone.
slides.notes: Swap the image for a looped video to bring motion principles to life.

slides.title: Proof points
slides.subtitle: Highlight traction that signals product-market resonance.

slides.title: Sequence the path to launch with calm confidence
slides.subtitle: Show what happens next and how you de-risk each phase.

items.label: Phase 01
items.title: Foundations
items.description: Finalize architecture, core flows, and trust framework.
highlights: Ship V1 DLS tokens and accessibility review.

items.label: Phase 02
items.title: Experiments
items.description: Run live pilots with closed cohorts to pressure-test the model.
highlights: Measure activation, comprehension, and repeat usage.
Iterate on micro-interactions with motion presets.

items.label: Phase 03
items.title: Scale & partner
items.description: Expand to priority segments with co-marketing and co-creation.
highlights: Localize content and voice for key regions.
Launch governance rituals to keep the system elegant.

slides.caption: Give every phase a measurable outcome and a responsible owner.
slides.notes: Adjust timing bands to match your strategy. Replace highlights with deliverables if helpful.

slides.title: Introduce the humans crafting the experience
slides.subtitle: Spotlight cross-functional partners and why they are uniquely suited.

slides.caption: Use consistent bios—role, credibility, and why the mission matters to them.
slides.notes: Swap titles and highlights for your actual team; keep descriptions short and specific.

slides.title: Invite partners to shape the next milestone
slides.subtitle: Be clear about the decision, the timeline, and how you support them.
points: Summarise the single action you want in the next 7 days.
Reassure with the support ecosystem they can rely on.
Clarify what success looks like after the decision.
slides.caption: Close with confident, human language—this is an invitation, not a push.
slides.notes: Offer exactly one primary call to action. Backup options should still feel proactive.
